sections.title: Unsafety
sections.content:
Unsafety

Unsafety is the presence of [unsafe operation]s and [unsafe trait
implementation]s in program text.

An unsafe operation is an operation that may result in
undefined behavior that is not diagnosed as a static error.
[Unsafe operation]s are referred to as unsafe Rust.

The [unsafe operation]s are:

* Dereferencing a value of a raw pointer type.

* Reading or writing an external static.

* Reading or writing a mutable static.

* Accessing a field of a union, other than to assign to it.

* Calling an unsafe function.

* Calling macro core::arch::asm.

An unsafe context is either an unsafe block or an
unsafe function.

An unsafe operation shall be used only within an unsafe context.
